Human Resource Associate Job at Obsidian Capital




        
    

        
        Obsidian Capital is a Principal Investment firm established in 2014 with a focus on transforming African lives by creating companies that deliver sustained, long-term beneficial impact. The firm designs locally specialized, globally competitive, large-scale private-sector solutions to infrastructure challenges in middle Africa. Located in Lagos State, Nigeria, Obsidian Capital aims to transform the infrastructure landscape of middle Africa, particularly in renewable and sustainable power infrastructure.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Associate
Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Description
     

            
    




	As a Human Resource Associate, you will be responsible for managing end-to-end HR functions with a focus on recruiting top talent, managing employee engagement, overseeing payroll, and supporting general HR operations.
	You will be a key partner in ensuring our workforce remains motivated, productive, and aligned with organizational goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead full-cycle recruitment and talent acquisition, identifying top talent across multiple channels.
	Manage talent management processes, including performance management, promotions, and succession planning.
	Drive employee engagement initiatives and maintain a positive organizational culture.
	Oversee payroll processes, leave management, and other HR administrative tasks.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws and internal HR policies.
	Partner with management to support workforce planning and HR strategy.
	Utilize HR analytics to provide insights for improving HR processes and employee experience.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Human Resources, or related field.
	5 – 10 years of proven experience in HR, with a strong focus on recruitment and talent management.
	CIPM certification is mandatory.
	Proficiency in Mac OS and Apple productivity tools (Pages, Numbers, Keynote).
	Strong knowledge of HR operations, payroll management, and employee engagement strategies.
	Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and organisational skills.
	Knowledge of labor laws and HR compliance
	Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.


What We Offer


	Competitive compensation and benefits.
	A collaborative and high-performance work environment.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.


Application Closing Date
Not Specified.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: hrpartners.recruitments@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front Desk Officer",
  "description": "Kursi Group is a Nigerian-based mining, mineral processing, and trading company. Incorporated in 2005, the company has grown to become one of Nigeria&rsquo;s largest and most reliable mining and trading firms. The head office is located in Abuja, with mining, operational, and processing sites spread across 22 of the 36 states in Nigeria. Kursi holds titles for some of the most viable mineral assets in Nigeria, with combined mineral resources and reserve estimates of over USD 100 billion. We mine, process, and trade in base metals, precious stones, and rare earth minerals, supplying off-takers, manufacturers, and end-users in the global value chain.

Our gold mining and processing lines have the capacity to process 8,500 tons of ore per day, with optimal grade recovery rates. We also lead the Nigerian market in mining and trading of lithium, lead, zinc, tin, columbite, tantalite, monoxide, manganese, wolframite, graphite, and fluorite.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Job Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	The Front Desk Officer serves as the first point of contact for visitors, clients, and staff. This role ensures professional front desk operations, courteous and efficient service, accurate handling of inquiries, proper visitor management, and smooth daily office operations.
	The role also supports administrative functions to facilitate operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Welcome and receive all visitors professionally, issuing visitor identification and ensuring proper access.
	Manage incoming calls, emails, and correspondence, directing them to the appropriate departments or personnel.
	Respond to inquiries accurately and escalate issues when necessary.
	Maintain detailed visitor logs and submit regular reports to the supervisor.
	Schedule appointments and provide support to internal teams.
	Maintain the reception area and common spaces in a clean, organized, and professional manner.
	Coordinate with security and other departments to ensure smooth front office operations.
	Support administrative tasks as needed to ensure operational efficiency.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Public Administration, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a customer-facing, administrative, or front office role.
	Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
	Excellent organizational, multitasking, and time-management abilities.
	Professional and friendly demeanor with strong customer service orientation.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) and general office systems.
	Ability to handle stress, remain calm under pressure, and prioritize tasks effectively.
	Demonstrated teamwork, collaboration, and reliability.


Work Environment:


	Based at the Abuja Head Office with daily interaction with staff, visitors, and vendors.
	Supports corporate administrative operations while maintaining a professional and welcoming office environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location: Abuja
Job Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	The Front Desk Officer serves as the first point of contact for visitors, clients, and staff. This role ensures professional front desk operations, courteous and efficient service, accurate handling of inquiries, proper visitor management, and smooth daily office operations.

Key Responsibilities


	Welcome and receive all visitors professionally, issuing visitor identification and ensuring proper access.
	Manage incoming calls, emails, and correspondence, directing them to the appropriate departments or personnel.
	Respond to inquiries accurately and escalate issues when necessary.
	Maintain detailed visitor logs and submit regular reports to the supervisor.
	Schedule appointments and provide support to internal teams.
	Maintain the reception area and common spaces in a clean, organized, and professional manner.
	Coordinate with security and other departments to ensure smooth front office operations.
	Support administrative tasks as needed to ensure operational efficiency.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Public Administration, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a customer-facing, administrative, or front office role.
	Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
	Excellent organizational, multitasking, and time-management abilities.
	Professional and friendly demeanor with strong customer service orientation.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) and general office systems.
	Ability to handle stress, remain calm under pressure, and prioritize tasks effectively.
	Demonstrated teamwork, collaboration, and reliability.


Work Environment:


	Based at the Abuja Head Office with daily interaction with staff, visitors, and vendors.

Warehouse Manager Job at Kursi Group




        
    

        
        Kursi Group is a Nigerian-based mining, mineral processing, and trading company. Incorporated in 2005, the company has grown to become one of Nigeria’s largest and most reliable mining and trading firms. The head office is located in Abuja, with mining, operational, and processing sites spread across 22 of the 36 states in Nigeria. Kursi holds titles for some of the most viable mineral assets in Nigeria, with combined mineral resources and reserve estimates of over USD 100 billion. We mine, process, and trade in base metals, precious stones, and rare earth minerals, supplying off-takers, manufacturers, and end-users in the global value chain.
     

            
    



Our gold mining and processing lines have the capacity to process 8,500 tons of ore per day, with optimal grade recovery rates. We also lead the Nigerian market in mining and trading of lithium, lead, zinc, tin, columbite, tantalite, monoxide, manganese, wolframite, graphite, and fluorite.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Manager

Job Location: Bode Saadu, Kwara 
Job Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	The Warehouse Manager will oversee all warehouse operations at the Bode Saadu mining site, ensuring accurate inventory management, efficient material handling, safety compliance, and seamless support to mining operations.
	The role involves supervising warehouse staff, optimizing storage and workflows, and delivering timely reports to site management to enhance operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities
Leadership & Team Management:


	Lead, mentor, and supervise all warehouse staff and supervisors at the Bode Saadu site.
	Conduct regular performance reviews, team briefings, and skills gap analyses.
	Perform site inspections to monitor warehouse operations, staff performance, and adherence to SOPs.


Inventory & Material Management:


	Maintain accurate stock records for mining materials, spare parts, and consumables.
	Conduct monthly physical stock counts and unplanned spot checks.
	Implement FIFO (First-In, First-Out) and FEFO (First Expiry, First-Out) inventory principles.
	Monitor critical, slow-moving, or expiring stock and take corrective actions to prevent losses.
	Investigate and resolve inventory discrepancies caused by damage, theft, or system errors.


Warehouse Operations & Process Optimization:


	Develop, implement, and enforce site-specific SOPs for material handling, storage, and dispatch.
	Identify process bottlenecks and implement improvements to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.
	Coordinate with mining operations, maintenance, and logistics teams to ensure timely supply Optimize warehouse layout, storage systems, and workflows to maximize operational efficiency.


Reporting & Analysis:


	Review and analyze daily and weekly stock reports submitted by warehouse supervisors.
	Provide timely and actionable reports to Site Management on stock levels, operational issues, and material utilization.
	Deliver insights to improve inventory management and warehouse performance.


Compliance & Safety:


	Ensure compliance with mining site safety regulations, environmental standards, and Conduct periodic safety inspections and enforce corrective actions.
	Identify operational risks, including fire hazards, unsafe handling, and stacking issues, and implement preventive measures.


Team Development & Training:


	Identify training needs and support professional development for warehouse staff.
	Foster a culture of accountability, discipline, and continuous improvement.


Qualifications & Experience


	B.Sc. / M.Sc. in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	4–6 years of progressive warehouse or inventory management experience, preferably in mining, heavy equipment, or industrial operations.
	Proven experience in supervising teams and optimizing warehouse processes.
	Strong knowledge of warehouse management principles, inventory control, and safety standards.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and warehouse/ERP management systems.
	Excellent leadership, organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Work Environment


	This role is primarily based at the Bode Saadu mining site.
	The position requires managing warehouse operations in an industrial setting, including rugged terrain and exposure to heavy equipment and active mining operations.
	Occasional travel to other operational sites may be required.


Method of Applicationn
